result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad E Exner in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Chad E Exner in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF32.  Agreement has been reached in these matters, court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
16CF13-DE will enter a plea to amended Ct's 1,2.  Ct's 3,4 will be DRI.  Case 16CF32 will be DRI.  

16CF13-Amended Ct 1-943.10(1m)  NC,

              Amended Ct 2-NC,   Court accepts both and finds the DE guilty.   Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order sentence withheld, 5 years probation, AODA assessment, 6 months jail, credit for 145 days, will pay restitution of $1575.00 and $900.00, J/S with Lisa K Johnson, Rusk cases 16CF31, 16CF26, CC, no voting, no firearms, comply with DOC programming, DNA sample and surcharge.
Notice of hearing for 8/31/16 court date was returned by PO.  JA resent to the defendant c/o Kenosha County Jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad E Exner
Current: 4777 88th Ave, Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2016)
Prior: 921 85th Street, Kenosha, WI 53145
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Scott A Johnson, Nancy J Conrad, Lisa K Johnson or the residence at N5589 Johnson Road

Defendant Chad E Exner in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Chad E Exner in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF32.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE/Atty will waive PH in each case.  Court instructs on waiver of PH.  Court will accept waiver.    Court reviews cases, finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  DE makes demand for speedy trial.  If information mirrors the CC, Atty would like to proceed to arraignment.   Waive reading of the informaiton, enter plea of NG on both cases.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond, would like a sign bond so DE may be allowed work privilege. Court will authorize a $25,000.00 sign bond, same as conditions  set out in 16CF13.  Set for JT 16CF13, 8-31-16 and 9-12-16 JT in 16CF32.  Final PTC 8-22-16 @ 11:00AM.
NOH-return to sender, no such address
Initial appearance on June 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
